comments.body: `$'<string>'` is similar to other "regular" strings (`"<string>"`, `'<string>'`), but additionally resolves some extra escape sequences (so `$'<string>'` is roughly equivalent to `$(echo -e '<string>')`)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +5,9 @@
# .gitconfig can be excluded since git config files are customarily indented with tabs rather than spaces
if git --no-pager grep -In $'\t' -- ':(exclude)./.gitconfig'; then
  die '\nThe above lines contain tab character (instead of spaces), please tidy up'
fi
